info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 4:59PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Mesa County through 530 PM MDT... At 459 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Palisade, or 8 miles east of Grand Junction, moving south at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Grand Junction, Palisade, Cameo, Fruitvale, Clifton, Orchard Mesa and Whitewater. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 31 and 46. U.S. Highway 50 in Colorado between mile markers 34 and 42. Colorado 141 between mile markers 153 and 162. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning and moderate to heavy rain is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
